pullRequest.title: Cosmos model package
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR addresses API - review comments for creating a model package - and moving model classes to the new model package.
Moves all these classes to model:
** Response classes
** Most of the enums
** Some of the policies
** Sql param / query / spec classes
** Resource
** JsonSerializable
To help the change, and reduce the scope, ModelBridgeInternal has been added to model package
It will be easier to review this PR comment by comment.

commit.message: Created model package, moved ChangeFeedOptions to implementation package
Moved compositePath to model package
Moved CosmosAsyncContainerResponse, properties, and more files to model
Moved Cosmos Async Item Response to model
Moved permission response and  properties
Moved Cosmos Async Stored Procedure Response
Moved Cosmos Async Trigger Response
Moved UserDefined Async Response
Moved Cosmos Async User Response to model
Moved other Cosmos Response types to model package
Moved all request option classes to model package
Moved Database Account and Database Account Location to model
Fixed constructor accessor
Moved FeedOptions and FeedResponse to model package
Moved feed response to model
Moved triggers, indexes, sql params, unique keys to model package
Moved partition key, partition key definition, and other options
Moved Resource, JsonSerializable, and cosmos error to model package

nodes.bodyText: why FeedResponse is a model but pageFlux is not?
FeedResponse was moved to model, why CosmosPageFlux is not a model?
question: ThrottingRetryOption is not a rest contract. it defines client behaviour on throttling. Is this qualify for a model?
I am not sure if this is a model. as it specifies client behaviour not over wire contract
why do we need the setMapper?

can you move instantiateJsonSerializable to model package?
If you do that then you don't have to do setAccessible()
same here. if instantiateJsonSerializable is moved to model package, setAccessable should be required.

commit.message: Moved feed response diagnostics and throttling retry options back to cosmos. Moved CosmosPagedFlux and CosmosPagedIterable to model

nodes.bodyText:
I am not sure if CosmosPageFlux is a model or not.
From one perspective  using CosmosPageFlux internally will issue IO request to fetch more results, so it shouldn't be a model.
from another perspective, other query result classes are model, so one may say this one is a model too.
Can we check what some other services are doing? is any other service sdk using pageflux?

commit.message: Moved CosmosPagedFlux and CosmosPagedIterable to cosmos package
